node.title: 'Not the smartest thing': Black Caps star breaks hand punching bat, ruled out of T20 World Cup final
node.alt: A New Zealand batter walks off the field holding his bat at the men's T20 World Cup.
node.description: An outburst of frustration leaves Devon Conway nursing a broken hand following New Zealand's semi-final victory over England, ruling the wicketkeeper-batterÂ out of the tournament decider against Australia.
node.content: ["New Zealand's Devon Conway has been ruled out of the men's T20 World Cup final against Australia after he broke his right hand by punching his bat during the Black Caps' win over England.", "The wicketkeeper-batter\u00a0sustained the injury following his dismissal for 46\u00a0in Thursday morning's (AEDT) semi-final and he has been replaced by Tim Seifert.\u00a0", "Conway will also be unavailable for the Black Caps' upcoming tour of India.", "\"While it's not the smartest thing he's done, there's certainly an element of bad luck in the injury,\" New Zealand coach Gary Stead said.", "\"He's certainly remorseful around it, it's an honest mistake he has made.", "\"He knows it's having an impact on our team as well, but that will provide an opportunity for someone else to come into the side and step up on the biggest stage now.", "Conway's injury is a needless headache for Stead and captain Kane Williamson, as New Zealand prepares for its\u00a0first men's T20 World Cup final against an Australian team with its tails up after beating Pakistan in Friday's (AEDT) second semi-final.", "Seifert has not played a match since the Black Caps were well beaten by Pakistan in their tournament opener over two weeks ago.", "Conway batted at number four against England but Seifert \u2014 who was seventh in the batter order against Pakistan \u2014 would be unlikely to replace his teammate in the higher slot.", "\"Whether we bring Glenn Phillips up one and put Seifert in behind him is something that Kane and I have to work through over the next day or so,\" Stead said.", "Phillips batted at number five against England.", "New Zealand has\u00a0known only heartbreak in men's World Cup finals.", "The Black Caps were beaten by England\u00a0via\u00a0a boundary count in the 50-over tournament in 2019, while they were crushed by Australia in the 2015 edition.", "Reuters"]
